description: Probability extraction test suite for SelfCheckGPT coherence variants

test_cases.statement: Two plus two equals four.
test_cases.rationale: Mathematical tautology. Definitionally true in standard arithmetic.

test_cases.statement: Water freezes at 0 degrees Celsius at standard atmospheric pressure.
test_cases.rationale: Well-established physical constant by definition.

test_cases.statement: Paris is the capital of France.
test_cases.rationale: Universally accepted geographical fact.

test_cases.statement: Humans need oxygen to survive.
test_cases.rationale: Universal biological fact about human survival.

test_cases.statement: World War II ended in 1945.
test_cases.rationale: Well-documented historical fact.

test_cases.statement: A triangle has three sides.
test_cases.rationale: Definitional truth in geometry.

test_cases.statement: The Earth orbits around the Sun.
test_cases.rationale: Established heliocentric model, universally accepted in modern science.

test_cases.statement: Mount Everest is the tallest mountain on Earth.
test_cases.rationale: Well-documented geographical fact, though technically depends on measurement method (above sea level vs. from base).

test_cases.statement: Christopher Columbus reached the Americas in 1492.
test_cases.rationale: Widely accepted historical fact.

test_cases.statement: Most people sleep at night.
test_cases.rationale: Generally true but has exceptions (shift workers, different time zones).

test_cases.statement: Lightning typically strikes the tallest object in an area.
test_cases.rationale: Generally true but not always - lightning behavior is more complex.

test_cases.statement: Eating breakfast is healthier than skipping it.
test_cases.rationale: Debated topic with research on both sides. Context-dependent.

test_cases.statement: The Library of Alexandria was destroyed by Julius Caesar's troops.
test_cases.rationale: Historical debate exists - multiple destruction events occurred, Caesar's involvement is one theory.

test_cases.statement: Africa is larger than North America in land area.
test_cases.rationale: True fact that may not be universally known due to map projection distortions.

test_cases.statement: Vitamin C supplementation prevents the common cold.
test_cases.rationale: Scientific consensus shows limited or no preventive effect, but popular belief persists.

test_cases.statement: The probability of flipping a fair coin and getting heads three times in a row is exactly 1/6.
test_cases.rationale: False - the actual probability is 1/8, not 1/6. This is a clear mathematical error.

test_cases.statement: Napoleon Bonaparte was born in Australia.
test_cases.rationale: Completely false - Napoleon was born in Corsica, not Australia.

test_cases.statement: The Pacific Ocean is the smallest ocean on Earth.
test_cases.rationale: Completely false - the Pacific is the largest ocean, not the smallest.

test_cases.statement: Humans can photosynthesize like plants.
test_cases.rationale: Biologically impossible - humans lack chloroplasts and the necessary cellular machinery.

test_cases.statement: The sky appears green during clear daytime weather.
test_cases.rationale: Contradicts universal human experience - the sky appears blue, not green.

test_cases.statement: Pluto is classified as a dwarf planet.
test_cases.rationale: Official classification by IAU since 2006.

test_cases.statement: The Great Wall of China is visible from space with the naked eye.
test_cases.rationale: Common myth that has been debunked by astronauts. Width and color make it nearly impossible to see from orbit.

test_cases.statement: Zero is neither positive nor negative.
test_cases.rationale: Mathematical definition - zero is the additive identity and is neither positive nor negative.

test_cases.statement: The Amazon River is the longest river in the world.
test_cases.rationale: Contested - depends on measurement method. Amazon vs Nile is debated, with recent measurements favoring Amazon but not universally accepted.

test_cases.statement: Coffee is the most consumed beverage in the world.
test_cases.rationale: False - water and tea are more consumed globally than coffee.

test_cases.statement1: Water boils at 100 degrees Celsius at standard pressure.
test_cases.statement2: Ice melts at 0 degrees Celsius at standard pressure.
test_cases.rationale: Both are physical constants that are true simultaneously. They are independent facts about different phase transitions of water.

test_cases.statement1: Tokyo is the capital of Japan.
test_cases.statement2: Beijing is the capital of China.
test_cases.rationale: Both geographical facts are true and independent of each other.
Both mathematical facts are independently true.

test_cases.statement1: The American Civil War occurred in the 1860s.
test_cases.statement2: The Emancipation Proclamation was issued during the American Civil War.
test_cases.rationale: Both true and causally related - the Proclamation was issued during the war, making them positively correlated.

test_cases.statement1: Photosynthesis produces oxygen as a byproduct.
test_cases.rationale: Both true and mechanistically related - they describe the same biological process.

test_cases.statement1: It is currently raining in London.
test_cases.statement2: It is currently raining in Sydney.
test_cases.rationale: Weather in different cities is largely independent. Joint probability should approximate product of individual probabilities.

test_cases.statement1: The Sahara Desert is located in Africa.
test_cases.statement2: The Sahara Desert is located in Europe.
test_cases.rationale: Mutually exclusive - the Sahara cannot be in both Africa and Europe. P(A∧B) should be near 0.
Logically mutually exclusive - a number cannot be both even and odd.

test_cases.statement2: Alexander the Great never conquered any territory.
test_cases.rationale: First statement is true, second is false. They describe contradictory historical narratives.

test_cases.statement2: The same person's heart rate is elevated.
test_cases.rationale: Positively correlated - exercise typically causes elevated heart rate. P(A∧B) > P(A) × P(B).
Strong causal relationship - rain causes wet ground. P(wet ground | rain) >> P(wet ground).
Plants need sunlight for photosynthesis and growth. P(growing | sunlight) is high.

test_cases.statement2: The person was born in Brazil.
test_cases.rationale: Most Brazilians speak Portuguese. P(Portuguese | Brazil) >> P(Portuguese).

test_cases.statement1: A randomly selected number between 1 and 100 is even.
test_cases.statement2: The same number is divisible by 10.
test_cases.rationale: All numbers divisible by 10 are even. P(even | divisible by 10) = 1.0.

test_cases.statement1: A historical figure was a scientist.
test_cases.statement2: The same figure was a Renaissance painter.
test_cases.rationale: Some Renaissance painters (like Leonardo da Vinci) were also scientists, but this is relatively rare. P(scientist | painter) is elevated but not very high.
